review.reviewBody:
I've been climbing skwamas for two years now. I'm a street shoe size US7 and I originally got the Skwamas in a 37.5. They were fine if I climbed a lot, but felt tight if I let the shoe shrink back. I decided to size up to a 38.5 for my new pair and I really like the fit right out the box. 

I can see myself using the smaller size for more slabby walls, and the 38.5 when a more comfortable fit is wanted. Seriously such a great shoe
review.name: My favorite climbing shoes

name: Skwama Climbing Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is a beautiful pair of classic western boots. I bought them. To replace a pair of vintage boots that I have had for over 30 years and had resoled at least three times.. I love that these boots are graceful, without being too frilly. The heel is also more of a classic western heel than so many modern boots.
review.name: Elegant stitching

review.reviewBody: This boot runs narrow. The craftsmanship is very stiff!
review.name: Size Up!
comment: Thank you for your feedback on these boots. We so appreciate you taking the time to leave a review. Look out for an email from us where we can further discuss this issue. We’re here to help!

review.reviewBody: Great fit, good under jeans, not uncomfortable to walk in.
review.name: Good fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the design and look of the boots. I got many compliments when I wore them. You can tell they are well made. My only negative is that they're a little heavier than my other boots but maybe it's just getting used to it. I would buy them again.
review.name: Jennings StretchFit Western Boot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I loved these soo much but I truly have giant calves and they were just a little too snug for my liking. Had to return unfortunately.
review.name: Beautiful but too tight for my giant calves

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They are very comfortable, easy wear, and stretchable boots. Highly recommend!
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is an absolutely beautiful boot. I wanted it to work but the boot is very narrow and tight across the top of your foot.  My feet are somewhat wide and these boots just didn’t fit.  Ariat please make more or your boots in wide widths for women:)
review.name: Gorgeous but Narrow:(

review.reviewBody: Unmatched fit, comfort, and style. Absolutely love the Distressed Ivory with my summer dresses and shorts. I am size 39 in Birks, 8.5-9 in running shoes. The 8.5 iin the Jennings Stretch Fit is perfect and I can dance all night with no sore feet! Hope to see some browns and blues in these boots. I want them in every color!
review.name: Style AND Comfort!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] First timer with buying a western boot.  I was nervous to purchase but I'm glad I pulled the trigger and bought them. These are super comfortable and I'm happy with my purchase :)
review.name: First time buyer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Beautiful boots however they run big so I would suggest sizing down a half size of you have narrow feet.
review.name: Beautiful

review.reviewBody: So warm and cute! I wish there were a skinnier leg/waist option as my daughter is on the smaller side.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My daughter finds them comfortable and warm! I do wish that the pants had belt loops though.
review.name: Great pants at a great price point!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My daughter received so many compliments on these pants while she was skiing.
review.name: Great color scheme!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The adjustable waist works well for thin girls. Keeps my pre-teen warm and is made well.
review.name: Quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This color is so beautiful, purple with blue undertone. High quality and fits really well for 5" height.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are awesome pants...they keep my kiddo warm, dry and comfortable. I do wish the waist was more adjustable. The waist is slightly big.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought these pants to wear with the Arctic Coat so my 12 year old granddaughter would enjoy being outdoors for more then a few minutes. Mission accomplished! Adjustable waste works well and the length was good for the average height of a 12 year old girl. She wears over clothes. These pants appeared to run narrow and my granddaughter is very slim. I went from ordering a Large to an XXL to fit! Gave 4 stars due to the high price since other sites have snow pants that are comparable at a fairer price but granddaughter loves the NorthFace brand.
review.name: Very Good Product at a Very High Price

review.reviewBody: From the midsole down I give these shoes a five star - comfort even for long dry hikes, excellent stickiness to rock. They are not great at edging because they are round which is great for protecting feet from injuries. From midsole up I give these two stars, the only good things are that they are (very loosely open) hightops, and that laces are stronger in water than TXGuides. If there is a rock in the canyon, these boots will put that rock between your ankle and the upper, requiring you to stop frequently to remove rocks. These will also fill your boot with gravel. Again, requiring you to stop to empty gravel. Whoever made these didn't try them in a canyon.  Laces also untie in flow, and these exposed laces will drown you by catching strainers and holding you under water. Or break your leg, whichever happens first. Poorly designed shoes. Could all be fixed by having a neoprene gaiter that protects laces and keeps out gravel. Such would also increase foot warmth by reducing flow. Instead we get three layers of velcro straps that accomplish...nothing at all???
review.name: Definitely not made for canyons

review.reviewBody:
Built off the TXS GTX with +2 size extension for
correct fit using 2-4mm Neoprene socks.
review.name: La Sportiva video

review.reviewBody: Went with my normal size of sneakers and I absolute love! They are incredibly comfy! They have a larger toe bed in my own opinion so def roomy so not my fave shoes to run in but to beep bop around town they are perfect! The egg color is beautiful!
review.name: Absolutely love!

review.reviewBody: I've tried different brands of sneakers and I have to say that HOKA is one of my favorites. It provides better support and cushion when I run. I've always had an issue with my knees and ankles. This is my first time running in Mach 6. It is comfortable and my knee issues have lessened. The problem I have with this version is the narrowness. My normal size is 7.5D. I try not to purchase beyond 7.5 only because I find the top of the shoe tends to flip upward if it is too long, making it look like genie shoes. 7.5D was too narrow so I hesitantly tried 8D. It actually is not that much longer and the widest part of my foot aligns with the widest part of the shoe and so far, no issues with my feet hurting/blistering after a run. Didn't like the Clifton 9 due to the extreme duckbill. Bondi felt like too much cushion. The color options for the Mach 6 wide version is limited.
review.name: Good but narrow

review.reviewBody: I work 12 hours shift, this shoes make a big difference
review.name: this is my third purchase. i feel like I'm walking on cloud

review.reviewBody: This is my 3rd Mach (had the 4 and 5) and loved them so much and was excited to get my new pair BUT I am disappointed in the Mach 6. They are totally different than the previous ones. Not sure I'll keep them as I just got them today and took a short walk to try them out. I'll see how they do on my long walk. Ughh, finally found a pair of shoes that fit great and now looks like I'll have to go back shopping around!
review.name: So sad they changed the Mach!!

review.reviewBody: My husband and daughter have a few pairs of Hoka sneakers so I had high expectations. The sneakers did not live up to it.
review.name: Not as expected!

review.reviewBody: I've had chronic pain from bone spurs and plantar fasciitis since February of this year. I'm an avid runner, have been running since my early teens and now it's caught up to me. I have been a fan of minimalist running shoes for most of this time, and my podiatrist said that my shoes were the issue. I didn't want to listen and he even made me some stupid inserts which were annoying to wear. But, finally during my last visit I asked him what brands he would recommend and he recommended this one. I raised my brows because I've always been against clunky running shoes, but figured I had nothing to lose and thought it would be better than the inserts. So, I ordered my first pair, the Mach 6, the lightest Hoka, and after wearing them my feet have been hurting less and less! I have been on two runs this past week as I'm taking it slow for now, and my left heel is still a little achy but it's so much better than the constant pain I had been living with. I'm so happy that I'm able to run again without pain. I'm ordering my second pair today, the Bondi 8. Turns out my feet do like clunky running shoes.
review.name: What the Clunk?!

review.reviewBody: They are so comfortable right out of the box and feel so responsive. Just what ii was looking for. I'm only giving 4 stars because I feel they aren't as supportive as I expected. Sorry I might need another pair sooner because I may wear them out. But I will be buying another pair when needed!
review.name: Comfortable and feel great on my first run out of the box

review.reviewBody: The most comfortable shoes ever a have ( I have a lot of pairs)
review.name: I would buy this again

review.reviewBody: I am so sad that HOKA re-made the MACH's. My MACH 5's are my favorites but this new one is just awful. I previously ordered my regular size 7 and they were so narrow and short that I returned them disgusted. I thought I would try the 7 WIDE thinking they would be roomier b/c I just love the MACH 5's but they were just as snug and short as the regular 7. I used to recommend HOKA's to everyone and now I just cannot.
review.name: So Sad

review.reviewBody: I'm a total newbie at running(6ish months) and originally tried out a different popular running shoe and immediately returned them and ordered these Hokas. I love the color, cushion and how stable my feet feel in them while running. However, I have narrow feet and these are very narrow. I am out of my return window thinking maybe it was just because they needed to be broken in but that's not the case. Either way I love them but if you've got narrow feet maybe think about going wide or try the narrow and don't miss your window like I did.
review.name: Super cute but runs narrow

name: Mach 6 Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I love all things smartwool and live in there shirts probably 80% of the time.  However this particular T shirt has a much lower neckline that I don't like so am returning it.  I like the lightweight feel of the material but I can't get past the neckline.
review.name: Different neckline than other smartwool

review.reviewBody: this is the most lightweight merino fabric I could find: only 120 gsm. It is a very light fabric, but still that great soft high-performing merino blend fabric. It would be perfect for high-output activities in warmer weather, BUT it's not because the shirt is wide and baggy unlike a baselayer. It seems like this is not suposed to be a baselayer, but just a casual shirt, so they make it a bit looser. So I use Merino 150 as my baselayer, and I just use this shirt as a sleep shirt, and it's good for that.
review.name: light but baggy

review.reviewBody: Love the weight of this top, has an airy feel and an unbelievably soft hand. Based on your own personal fit preference, if you prefer a tighter/slimmer fit, I would recommend sizing down. I went from my normal large to a medium.
review.name: Love it but mind the fit

review.reviewBody: Just right in cut insulation and cozy qualities
review.name: Perfect in Every Way

review.reviewBody: This jacket seems well made but be warned that it is a slim fit.  There really isn’t room for layering underneath.  With a  t-shirt on, adding a light weight flannel resulted in it being bunched up inside the jacket.
review.name: Snug

review.reviewBody: Perfect for a cooler day over a t shirt or layering up for warmth. Fit is great and get protection from cooler weather.
review.name: Perfect for a cooler day

review.reviewBody: This is the third cirrus flex hoody that I have owned the fit is good and the reduced bulk under the arms and on the hood facilitates overalls and a climbing style helmet when I’m working offshore. I’m 5’8” and 92kg 44” chest and 36” waist and I have found the UK Large to fit the best as I’m keen on reducing any bulk from my layers system. I have given a four stars score as due to the side panels do get rather pearled and loose some elasticity over a relatively short period of time (180 months) and the very thin outer layers dose “click” overall I would recommend this jacket.
review.name: Good well made and fitted

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a thinner puffy with a hood, and I just can't shell out $300 for a jacket like this from Patagonia (Love their stuff but just way overpriced).  This fits me perfectly and keeps me warm on not-so-cold nights (30's and up) yet functional with the arm vents.  Great value.  I'm 6'2 and 165, if you're bigger/wider this won't fit you well it's a true athletic cut.
review.name: Perfect fit, warm and well worth the val

review.reviewBody:
Usually find Rab products very well made and secondly durable.
Unfortunately this it’s the case for this jacket as it’s now in a few poor state after 18 months a lot of the stuffing in the back has just gone to nothing so it’s not actually very warm now or any use.
review.name: Neil

review.reviewBody: Cosy well made, great fit snd colour snd windproof - great for a blustery beach walk!
review.name: Cosy well made, great fit

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket, maybe my favourite of all my Rab jackets, warm, breathable good fit, great zips and very packable
review.name: Best jacket yet

review.reviewBody:
Beautiful Jacket, lovely blue colour and the quality is nice.
Much better than my North Face jacket. I would say the fit comes up a bit small. Very smart, stylish and I would highly recommend. Thank you Rab.
review.name: Beautiful Jacket, lovely blue colour

review.reviewBody: Purchased my first 2022 really impressed, second from Cotswold, equally stylish, comfortable and suitable for all purposes and weathers. Therefore my choice for my recent purchase was style , colour and knowing that the fit would perfect , which it is.
review.name: Purchased my first 2022 really

review.reviewBody: These pants seem really well designed and well made but I think they are not quite the right fit for me. I don't like higher waisted pants or shorts when riding. With my body position forward on a bike, a constrictive waistband feels tight and uncomfortable. Also having a waist constriction closer to my diaphragm can restrict breathing. I would call the rise of these pants mid-waisted as it falls right on my belly button, but I prefer a waistband to sit lower to allow for the best movement and free breathing while in a riding position.
review.name: Nice pants, not quite the right fit

review.reviewBody: I bought a 2 in these, equivalent to my jeans size. They were tight on my thighs and loose in the waist. I have a very curvy bottom. The waist cinches were insufficient in a 2 so think buy with caution. They seem great, but not for me.
review.name: Small!

review.reviewBody: Good fit and function.  The zips on the bottom of the leg to get your knee pads on and off are the greatest.
review.name: the leg zips are awesome

review.reviewBody: I'm a huge fan of the OR Freewheel shorts, but I prefer to wear pants for everything except XC rips and 100+ degree days, so when the pants came out, I had to give them a try. Knowing the fit of the shorts, I went up a size to accommodate burlier knee pads, and that was definitely the right move! The waist adjustment cinches down plenty so that I don't notice the difference in waist size, and I don't notice any movement restrictions either. I have A LOT of mountain bike pants, and these by far are my favorites! My only wish is that they had hand pockets too for those extra chilly days or to hold my lift pass.
review.name: Even better than the shorts!

review.reviewBody: I have had many Altras (all Lone Peaks) but needed something more weather proof than the badly-named ALL-WTHR (doesn't take much to get soaked feet in those). I thought these would do the trick, but had to return them when I immediately noticed the same pain others have described in several reviews. The tongue is too wide and rubs against the ankle! My question to Altra: whenever someone points out this design flaw in their review, you respond that you take all reviews seriously and that the problem will be corrected in the future. Well, when I look through the reviews, this issue has been brought to your attention a long time ago (1-2 years?) When exactly are you going to fix this boot? As far as I know, this is the only waterproof model you carry and I'd really like to give it another try since everything else about this boot is an improvement over the All-WTHR. Give us a time-frame by which to check back!
review.name: Great hiker done in by a tongue that causes ankle blisters

review.reviewBody: I have worn these a few times. I like them so far. Very comfortable and my bunion has plenty of room. I haven't tested the waterproof part of it yet but will next time I'm on a true backpacking trip.
review.name: So far, so good

review.reviewBody: 1st I am a heavy set man my timp hiker gtx was bought for work they're light but very comfortable and water proof I really like these boots not too much cushion just enough great traction I've worn these almost every day M/F the heel of the soles are already breaking down I really hate that but very doubtful I will get 2 full months of use out of them before the start hurting my feet from the sole breakdown was really in hopes of a wonderful pair of boots yes I would recommend these boots to a non heavy weight person in a heart beat
review.name: Well

review.reviewBody: I loved the comfort and fit of this boot when I first got it. It felt great on the foot and I could wear it all day. However the first day I did boot things wearing it (light hiking) the toe cap and sole separated. I returned it to Altra within the window and it took WEEKS to get my refund. Now I really want to try the new Olympus hiker as I still haven't found a zero drop hiker to meet my needs, but due to my experience with the Timp hiker I'm worried that the Olympus will not hold up to even light hiking. It really is a shame, as there are Altra running shoes I want to try as well, but I am worried to after the quality (or lack there of) of the Timp. I would not buy this boot again though, even though it felt incredible on my foot.
review.name: I would not buy this boot.

review.reviewBody: I suffer from foot pain and Altras have been the answer Im slowly replacing all athletic footwear to the brand . So happy also you are offering a hiking boot in ALL BLACK that I can wear in my profession, GAME CHANGER!!!!!!!!because Im i on my feet ALOT !!. I'm an outdoorsman and these shoes are so comfortable to walk in. Look forward to new styles , me and my feet Thank you Altra!!!!!
review.name: Great Shoe

review.reviewBody: I have been hiking in Lone Peaks, buy they were not providing the cushion that I needed. I tried the Olympus, but they run small and ended up losing the skin and nail off one of my toes. I recently completed a 300 mile section hike of the AT and also did about 50 trail miles in the shoes to prep. I went across a lot of rock surfaces in NJ, NY, CT, and MA. These shoes served me well and I am glad that they are available, especially in the size (14) that I need. Thank you Altra for making this product and having the GoreTex version available.
review.name: Thank You Altra For Making This Product

review.reviewBody: Mulit 10+ mile hikes in snow with gaiters and my feet were soaked. Should not advertise as waterproof, more water resistant than anything else. I have huge feet, great fit and very comfy otherwise.
review.name: Not waterproof or even that water resistant but comfy.

review.reviewBody: I am a LEO & just bought a pair of these. I love them. My only comment is that they are loud. I get they are hiking boots but I wish they could be made with a quieter sole for law enforcement purposes
review.name: Great overall

review.reviewBody: For starters, I don't know if learning colors is hard or something for everyone who designed and green lit these shoes but they are not black. I've seen some reviews calling them gray or charcoal, which some of the material on the shoe is gray, but the rest of the shoe is clearly a dark navy color. Nothing black on these shoes at all. Thankfully I can still get away with dark navy at work so not a complete deal breaker but it's frustrating to see something as simple as color be marketed and labeled so incorrectly. Secondly I also experienced the issue with ankle pain from the tongue seam many other reviewers have complained about. It was tolerable for a shift, but I'll say I was quite relieved to take them off when I got home and don't really want to wear them again now. I'm hoping I can figure out a DIY modification to remedy this as there are several positives about the shoes. That covers the cons. As for the pros, the shoes are light weight, have great feeling soles that feel soft on the bottoms of my feet, and the outsoles provide great traction on a variety of surfaces. It's too soon to comment on durability but I expect top tier lifespan out of these for the type of shoe, price, and Altras reputation. Overall I'd say buy with caution with the above issues in mind. It is difficult for me to recommend these.
review.name: Just meh...

review.reviewBody: I bought this boots because I'm required to wear black duty boots. I have been wearing them but they are a weird dark gray color. Please make these in true black or make the line peak hiker version in all black. Overall good comfortable boot but the color is off.
review.name: Good duty boot but it's not black

name: Timp Hiker GTX Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.name: Terra Floor Pump
hasVariant.description: Buy the Silca Terra Floor Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I did not realize when I bought this that it was among the more affordable Silca models. It was twice the price of my last pump (another popular brand), but totally worth it. The way the metal pump head locks onto the valve feels very secure. The action on the pump handle is so smooth - I am not sure how to describe it but it is distinctive and efficient. Overall, the pump is extremely lightweight, so easy to carry. The way the hose routes and clips into brackets is one of the easiest I have used.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: I first came across this pump at my cousin's place and ordered my very own Terra floor pump before I left to come home.  I already have a nice Topeak floor pump but the Silca Terra stands out because of how accurate the pressure gauge is.  So nice!  I did I mention that it clamps on to the valve tight and secure?  Nothing is worse than having the nozzle pop off after a few pumps.  Plus the Silca Terra pump is super stylish with that matte green and wood handle and looks great hanging on the bike cave wall.  I wish I could buy one for all my biking friends for Christmas.
review.name: Love at first pump

review.reviewBody: Easy to use with very high quality fit and finish. A must purchase over a pump in a bike store.
review.name: Terrific pump.

review.reviewBody:
Like all Silca products, this pump doesn’t mess around. It pumps twice as fast as my Joe blow pump it replaces. It also doesn’t loose air when removing it from the valve. The gauge is nice and large and has been accurate so far.  

Used for MTB tires.
review.name: Great pump!

name: Terra Floor Pump

review.reviewBody:
I bought this helmet primarily because it was light weight and large enough to fit my pumpkin-sized head. It fits well but during the second season of its use the ear pads started delaminating badly and then totally failed and fell off.  Seems the glue holding the two halves of the pads together as well as to the mounting bracket dried out and totally failed (see pics below).  I contacted warranty@backcountry.com but they said the K2 warranty on helmets is only for one year so I’m out of luck. 
Buyers beware!
review.name: Light but ear pads totally delaminated

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro V8 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Having owned multiple pairs if the Hierro V7, which were OK for me, despite general poor reviews from others. I went ahead and purchased the Hierro V8. After a few wears I find myself somewhat disappointed. Overall, they feel cheap and underwhelming considering the hefty price tag. The laces are elastic and need to be replaced to prevent foot movement when running. The insole is far too hard and will need replacing. The tongue is poorly constructed. 

In summary, I put my trust in NB, and this time they have let me down.
review.name: Not bad, but not good either (cheap materials)

description: Buy the Kids Ride Shotgun Pro Combo Box - Kids' online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pro Combo Box - Kids'
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kids Ride Shotgun Pro Combo Box - Kids' online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with the engineering and quality of this product!  Simple installation, zero frame contact, fully adjustable and it is very easy to remove with the quick release connections. I highly recommend!
review.name: Awesome product and so much fun!

review.reviewBody: My daughter and I loved our original Shotgun, but it was still about 5 minutes to get it onto or off of my bike.  So I found myself sometimes not wanting to take that bike out because of the hassle.  The Pro-model is soo much quicker on and off and may even provide a little extra suspension for the rider.  Plus I don't have to worry about damaging my carbon frame with any direct contact. It's worth checking out some of the more formal online reviews that showcase how the Pro-model raises the child's seat height. It's not a noticeable change in center of gravity but it does matter if you're a shorter parent because there will be less room under your chin.   In sum, it's a bummer how expensive this is, but it is a major upgrade over the original.
review.name: Wish I bought this one first

name: Pro Combo Box - Kids'

description: Buy the ARVA Ride 30L+ Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ride 30L+ Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the ARVA Ride 30L+ Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The ARVA ride takes on a simple approach to a ruck sack design and makes it to perform in all the ways you need a in backcountry day pack. 
- Lightweight *****
- Functional *****
- Durable *****
- Adaptable *****

The frameless pack allows me to roll it up and take it with me on all off my trips. The multiple load options makes it adapt to smaller or larger load needs. I have been using the top load function more as I need more space to stow a puffy, field book (avy) and other quickly accessed items mid winter. The top pockets stow the repair kit, snacks well and the fleece lined pocket is great for goggles or sunglasses with out the case. The Avy gear pockets hold everything you need and you can access the gear quickly. The multiple snowboard carry options are great for solid or "a-framing" my splitboard. 

If you're looking for an affordable and functional lightweight pack, check out the Ride 30L+
review.name: KEEP IT SIMPLE WITH EVERYTHING YOU NEED

name: Ride 30L+ Backpack

review.reviewBody: Fleece hoody is warm and thick. Large is a looser fit for me but it was what I was looking for. 41" Chest, 33" waist, 5ft 9in height. Plenty of pockets. Only thing that I would have liked would have been a draw sting at the bottom of the jacket to prevent draft up the coat.

review.reviewBody:
BS'D
I found this fleece to be an excellent outer layer in the layering process typical of staying comfy. I would have liked zippers for the lower pockets. Thank you Mountain Hardwear.

review.reviewBody: Quality fleece.  Extremely  warm.  Perfect for under my goretex jacket, or as a stand alone coat.  My only complaint is,  it would be better if the wrist had the ability to  be adjusted  for size, so when it's  being worn by itself the wind doesn't  just go right up the sleeve. review.reviewBody: Warm, cozy, perfect for walking college campus. Ordered small for my son, 5’8”, 140lbs

review.reviewBody: Picked up my fleece this morning. I was wearing my old fleece jacket and didn't realize how much warmer I could be until I switched to my HiCamp Forest Green hooded fleece. I settled on a small over a size medium. Mainly because I like my fleeces to hug my body. I would recommend the medium if you plan to layer under your fleece. I'm also 5'7, 155 with a athletic build. The hoodie is amazing and when you have it up it feels like you're wrapped in a warm blanket.

review.itemreviewed: Blizzard GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The shoes were received with the right shoe yellow foam slightly cracked on the left side, and slight scuff mark next to it. The fishline stitching is also slightly off on the right side of the right shoe. When paying about $146 with shipping, it makes one wonder what else is wrong with the shoes.

The size also runs a little smaller than usual. The wrap around design at the top, made to keep the snow out, makes it worse for it tends to constrict the foot.
review.name: Used/damaged
comment: We are sorry to hear about the condition of the shoes you received and that the size was not as expected. We have sent you an email to discuss this further.

review.itemreviewed: Blizzard GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Obviously a pretty niche use case, but a really well engineered solution. I paid about $150 for them, which is obviously a little punchy for a limited use shoe, but they have been fantastic for winter trail running and I have got a fair bit of use out of them for more strenuous winter hiking too. The metal studs have been a lifesaver when I've encountered hidden ice under the snow while running.
review.name: Right tool for the job.

review.itemreviewed: Blizzard GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these last winter and have run everything from icy gravel path and pavement to mountain trails on Colorado and the Blizzard is amazing.  It's a medium/wide fit with plenty of room for my toes to splay while still keeping a narrow enough profile for technical trails.  I ultimately bought these a half size bigger than my Bushido II's and that's been a good fit with a thicker sock and providing a little more toe room.  I highly recommend these for year round running in the mountains and on slick/icy paths.
review.name: Studded all wheel drive for winter runs

review.itemreviewed: Blizzard GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great shoes for the trails. The metal studs or spikes are somewhat aggressive especially when on a hard surface. Love the shoes, my third pair (first with the studs) mountain boots and an early model of the ankle -lace wrap.
review.name: Trail shoes with a bite

review.itemreviewed: Blizzard GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’m able to run on icy roads without slipping thanks to these shoes!
review.name: Run on ice

review.itemreviewed: Blizzard GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased it online. Since it is unisex and in European size I had difficult time figuring out my size.  Both Uragano and Blizzard are the best shoes for my winter trail races.  I had better experience with Uragano, in contrary if I had size or half size bigger Blizzard it might’ve worked better.  It is worth the price, however it’d be too expensive to purchase another size bigger pare, which I’d probably do.
review.name: Winter trail ultra race

review.itemreviewed: Blizzard GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Awesome shoes for icy conditions. Fantastically light, warm, breathable, and fast. Love the comfort and the look. 5 stars
review.name: Great running shoes for icy conditions!

review.itemreviewed: Blizzard GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Living in the Sierra I spend most of my winter season on skis but try to get in a few days each week running to keep the legs turning over for the trail and ultra season.  The blizzard provides exceptional traction and security that allows me to keep things up tempo as needed and the comfort and warmth for longer runs as well.
review.name: Excellent winter addition

review.itemreviewed: Blizzard GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Absolutely love these. The lacing system is incredible. Makes the trails accesible in the winter up here in Maine. Nothing negative to say other than that I would love a wild color pattern.
review.name: Awesome! Ten out of ten.

review.itemreviewed: Blizzard GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have beaten these shoes in variable winter conditions for the past three weeks around 5 days a week, they are super comfortable and cozy even when they have been dunked in super cold melt water and then run through the snow. Stoked and looking forward to punishing them throughout this winter.
review.name: Super 4WD winter trail show

review.reviewBody: extremely light and packable hoodie jacket wears well, super compact and portable

review.reviewBody: This jacket is so light and packs down to something the size of an apple and yet blocks the wind brilliantly. Perfect for throwing on when you need to take the edge off the weather but theirs no rain and a hard shell would be sweaty overkill. It's tiny size also means you can always have it in your pack with virtually no weight penalty.
review.name: Featherweight wind stopper

review.reviewBody:
This is a cracking windproof! Nice and light, decent zip pockets and a good hood. Packs super small in its own stuff sack. A tiny carabiner would be nice to attach to a belt loop when not wearing, but most people will have one to assign.
My wife loves hers too. A must for windy top-outs.
review.name: This is a cracking windproof!

review.reviewBody: Really nice jacket, often put it on and completely forget I’m wearing it. Packs absolutely tiny so I’ve just been taking it everywhere. Even seems to keep me fairly dry in showers! Lovely to have on you for a windy belay or climb.
review.name: Light, comfortable and packs down small

review.reviewBody: Great bit of kit, very light and does a good job of keeping the wind and rain out. It can get a bit sweaty in there, but it's an essential top layer for me.

review.reviewBody: These boots are so comfortable and stylish.  I wear them nearly everyday to work.
review.name: Great boot!

review.reviewBody: Wonderfully comfy boots that you can walk for miles in.
review.name: Fab comfy stylish boots

review.reviewBody: This is just a gorgeous boot with great cushioning. I found it fit a half size large. I originally purchased my usual 6.5 but returned it for a 6. So far I am wearing them with thin socks because I have Morton's neuromas in both feet, and anything thicker causes discomfort. I'm assuming since they are suede they will stretch a little. But they are so good-looking I'm will to take that chance. I've worn Ariat boots for over 20 years, and the quality is still there.
review.name: Beautiful boots

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These boots are very light and it’s a really nice light pink, almost blush in color. Very light and comfortable.
review.name: Beautiful pink boots!

review.reviewBody: I love this boot!  I originally got the black waterproof pair and now have it in the light tan color, and it goes with everything - cropped flared jeans, straight full length jeans, black jeans or pants.  The sole is really lightweight compared with some chunkier boots and the insole is really cushy.  Fits true to size, but not a tight fit.  Its a roomy fit.  Love love love.
review.name: Versatile, functional fashion

hasVariant.name: Vantage Light Support Bralette - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Vantage Light Support Bralette - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is a great bra if you're looking for a minimal support, pretty design that has a nice sturdy material. I was looking for a bra that was comfortable, not a tight compression bra. These are really comfy, have a very low profile and the strap design is really pretty. I'm a bit barrel chested, so I ordered a large and these fit great. No struggling to get them on because they're so tight. I intend to wear biking and hiking primarily.
review.name: Minimal, nice back design

review.reviewBody: Super cute and nice amount of minimal support. As a small-chested person I don't like it when sports bras are too tight and compressed. This one has a nice amount of support for me. I wish the bottom band were slightly wider to distribute the pressure more (when it's thin like this one it can have a digging-in effect). But it's not too bad.
review.name: Cute, good support; bottom band is thinner than I prefer

name: Vantage Light Support Bralette - Women's

description: Buy the Gregory Border 25L Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Border 25L Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Border 25L Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This pack is perfect for daily use heading to the office. I use it every day and it holds everything for work. I have chargers an IPad, laptop, food, and a bunch of other stuff. It works great for a carry-on as well. I even recommended it to my 20 year old for school. You can’t go wrong with this thing, especially with the lifetime warranty.
review.name: Great backpack

review.reviewBody: I added "webbing" to the front so I could slip my jacket in there.  It was nice having my computer separate from everything else.  The security pocket came in handy.  It slid onto my roller bag with no problem, I tried it both with water bottle down and water bottle up and the water bottle stayed attached both ways.
review.name: New travel pack

review.reviewBody:
I'm using this bag mainly for work travel, and it's making the grade. Lots of great admin storage, packs lots of stuff, and still fits under the airplane seat in front of me nicely.

It's comfortable to wear, even when packed full for an overnight trip. There is enough versatility in the pockets that it might take a few tries to organize things the way you like, but I believe that's a major positive considering the personalization possibilities.

People that travel often know how important a good personal item bag is. This one works and looks great!
review.name: Great for frequent travel

review.reviewBody: Works well as an everyday bag and has enough space for a weekend trip.  Stylish and well-built.
review.name: Happy with my purchase

review.reviewBody: I love all the compartments for organization and the size is perfect for everything you need in a day (change of clothes, work stuff, laptop, etc)!
review.name: Perfect pack for commuting!

review.reviewBody: The pockets are all useful, even one for your mouse. I've taken it on an airplane.  I'm a backpack person, so it just made sense to use one for work instead of a briefcase.
review.name: All the things I hoped it would be!

review.reviewBody: The harness is very comfortable and the pack can actually carry some weight. Excellent construction, smooth zippers, nicely laid out pockets. My 2 issues are: no pocket in front big enough to hold a light jacket or fleece and the main pocket does not fully open (clamshell style) for easier packing. It's a nice daypack that almost successfully makes the transition to a legit travel backpack.
review.name: Very Good Travel Pack

review.reviewBody: Excellent travel backpack. Comfortable with great pockets, all in all a great pack for travel.
review.name: Functional Travel Pack

review.reviewBody:
I'm an avid rock climber and I put a lot of effort into researching and trying out gear to fit my particular needs. Seriously, it's like I've pulled an all-nighter to figure out who the Zodiac Killer is.  Looking into this pack to fit my commuter, travel and office needs was no exception.

This is the perfect city bag. It has pockets/compartments in every place you want and able to fit everything I need. The big thing for me, it can still fit a large water bottle on the side. Also, it doesn't deflate when it has less stuff and it sits very comfortably. 

I use this bag as my commuter bag for when I go to the office and when I travel for work. It will keep everything organized and compartmentalized. If you are looking for a bag to fit these needs, you've found it.
review.name: Perfect Commuter Bag

review.reviewBody: I have used this daily for a month now. I love it. The size is perfect for back-and-forth to work with a computer and charger, books, lunch and files (I walk 20mins each way). Lots of room but it isn't bulky at all. The fit is good (I'm 6'2"), and I buckle up the sternum strap when I'm walking longer distances. There are just enough sub-compartments inside to keep things separated, but it's not overwhelming. The outer pockets are very discrete. This has a clean, professional aesthetic, which I like. (I don't want my work bag to look like it belongs on Everest.)  Zippers feel robust and the pulls have nice detailing on them (comfy, rubberized toggles). The bag feels like it will last a long time. My only suggestion for Gregory designers would be to find a way to tuck the backpack straps away or keep them from flopping around when you carry the bag by the side handle like a briefcase. But that is a minor quibble!
review.name: Perfect commuter backpack

name: Border 25L Bag

review.reviewBody: Performed great, used them on multiple hikes through some pretty bad conditions and they have held up and look like new. Used them on my old hiking boots and on some Solomon trail runners and they fit both. Have not had any issues with them slipping off the heel and they have given grip in both slushy snow and ice.
review.name: Work as Intended

review.reviewBody: Purchased a pair for Angels Landing recent winter hike at Zion’s National Park - after reading reviews that crampons were a ‘must’ for icy/snowy conditions.  All I can say, other than ease of use and comfort, is that I’m still alive to review how these were the single deciding factor of survival on this awe inspiring but very dangerous uphill hike.
review.name: Life Saving for icy/snowing hikes

review.reviewBody: Needed a good pair of crampons for running, and hiking. These are perfect. When running, you don't feel the spikes other than you have great traction in snow and ice. Same with hiking and walking. Even if you find the occasional slippery rock, your traction is still great. Make sure to size down as you want them tight when putting them on. Otherwise, they will slip off your shoe/boot. Also, they're better than the chain type of crampons because you have more grip action
review.name: Amazing for hiking, walking or running

name: Chainsen Pro Crampon

review.reviewBody: Was very happy to get the chance to try this shoe, as I have had a few pairs of Salomon shoes in the past and always was a fan. To me, these definitely are a "training" shoe, something that is good for the gym or short runs. Personally, I would use something else for longer runs, but for just about anything else, I think these are great! Super comfortable to just wear around and they look great too!
review.name: Comfortable and Light

review.reviewBody:
I was given this product from Backcountry, but this review is my personal opinion.

The Salomon Predict SOC2 is a very comfortable shoe. Well designed and constructed, a quality shoe. My feet felt as if they were wrapped in a smooth glove sans joins or uncomfortable stitches to rub against.  As a former long distance marathon runner, BQ'd twice, I've worked his way through many brands and this is definitely more than just an acceptable runner's shoe. 

I found the last very comfortable no hot spots. I have a slight overpronation and found the neural form accommodated my foot and the last didn't try to modify it. This is very helpful as a shoe that materially influences ones foot/leg mechanics is to be avoided. Been there on long runs and knees suffer.  

I found the shoe very efficient, it absorbed my weight and impact well, yet produced a surprisingly noticeable bounce. I tend to be a heel toe runner and this last allowed me to vary between mid sole to heel strike effortlessly.  This helped me, as my foot was less fatigued. The cushioning and support was consistent throughout the length of the shoe.  The soft toe area really was very comfortable for my toes, no banging nor pressure on my toenails. 

Two words of advice, I have a size 12 narrow foot. The Salomon Predict SOC2 definitely held my foot nicely in position, not sure how it would be for medium or wider width foot. Shoe length was not true, it ran long so I downsized to an 11.
  
I haven't tried the shoe on fast track workouts yet and it is too early to say how long the springiness will last. They also look great with jeans per an admirer.
review.name: A delightful lightweight shoe

review.reviewBody:
(I'm an idiot and didn't realize I reviewed a past model by mistake)

I don't know what I expected, and I was quite impressed within the first couple of miles in these. I'm no Cinder-fella fit and I can wedge my feet into just about anything without much protest. As an enthusiast who's outrunning old age and obesity as best I can, I do lean towards some brands and builds over others. I haven't spent a day in Salomon since the Snow Dragon (or was it pipe dragon?) as I watched the ball drop on Y2K, and the return to these was a warm welcome. I didn't expect the traction i felt in loose rocks and the cush muted a lot of jagged edges that would otherwise translate through or alter the course of the shoe. I will be watching these to make sure the next gen isn't altered enough to justify loading up on this one before it disappears.

why not 5 stars?  i try to not LOVE shoes to avoid the heartbreak of their demise.
review.name: WOW (redux)

name: Predict Soc 2 Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got this for my camping quilt and it’ll hold a whole lot more too, now I have to rethink my packing…😄
review.name: Works great and holds a lot more than I thought

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these sack to keep everything organized in my pack
review.name: Compression sacks

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really happy with my 20 Liter compression sack. I use it for travel packing.
It compressed my clothes with minimal effort and minimal wrinkled garments. Very easy to use and sturdy. I definitely recommend this and my brother-in-law bought two based on my suggestion!
See my 'before' and 'after' pictures!!
review.name: Great purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this compression sack it has lasted me a while and I have used this same still for upwards of 2 years and I love it, it is the best combination of lightweight without sacrificing durability along the way.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased one of each of these packs for my daughter and son in law for Christmas because they are frequent travelers who like to contain their luggage to carry ons and a backpack each, especially when traveling internationally. They also go skiing a couple times a year and on that trip they have to pack very bulky jackets, ski pants, sweaters and lots of layers of clothes. They have not traveled with them yet, but they did do an experiment with stuffing one of them and they were amazed at what they were able to pack and how small they were to shrink the sack down to! They can't wait to use them next month for a ski trip. I have now decided to buy one for myself.
review.name: Ultra-Sil Compression Pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used almost daily on our 9 week backpacking trip! Sturdy, easy to use, compressed easily,
review.name: Great compression sack!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Like so many Sea to Summit products this one delivers on all expectations. Light, water resistant (bordering on waterproof) and well made. Keep up the great work STS!!!
review.name: Another great Sea to Summit purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got these for a beach vacay, with the hopes of compressing all my clothes, swim suits, etc to avoid a checked bag. I haven't gone on the trip yet, but I did test how many clothes it could stuff using clothes I had piled up in my hamper. I was very impressed, it could definitely hold more than a weeks outfits. the straps felt very durable. I was using my whole body weight and pulling as tight as I could, and the straps still felt like they weren't gonna budge. I'm very excited to be taking these on my trip, I'm looking forward to not having a huge mess of clothes and being able to comfortably pack other things in my carry on. Looking forward to using these on future trips!
review.name: Really well done!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Literally reduces the size of what I am packing to less than half. Will never go on a trip without this.
review.name: Necessity for packing

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I fly with carry-on luggage only, so being to get everything into my carry-on backpack is critical. These work extremely well for that purpose.I pack only synthetic clothes which don’t wrinkle, so crushing my clothes down is no problem.

Be sure to loosen all the straps when you unpack them, otherwise the shape of the tube will be uneven when you pack them next, and you won’t be able to pack them as efficiently. I think it’s helpful to own a few different sizes.
review.name: Will never travel without them.

name: Ultra-Sil 5L Compression Sack

review.reviewBody: I got the Small and I’m 5’7” 130lbs and it fits perfectly. These are the best! I love how they have an adjustable cinch at the ankles too. I got the black but might get it in the white and blue too because I love it that much.
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody:
Only one review mentioned this, so I assumed the chemical smell wouldn't last. After two washes (one with baking soda, which can even remove the smell of gasoline), the chemical smell is so overpowering that these can't even be worn. What an incredible waste, I'm so bummed!

Seriously, don't even give these a chance.
review.name: Chemical Smell Won't Come Out

review.reviewBody: I didn’t think I’d love these as much as I do. They’re so warm and comfortable. The pockets are big enough for my phone. I’m 5’11” so regular length pants are usually short on me, I sized up to a large and they completely cover my ankles.
review.name: LOVE these!

review.reviewBody: These are so good and so comfy, I am so glad I got these to lounge in. They cinch in at the back to give a bit of shape and are so fun and cute. I usually wear a medium but sized up to a large because I didn’t want them tight on the butt. I think this was a good call, the medium might have not worked for me -  I am curvy with a skiers butt. Only downside is that they smell quite strongly of a chemical like smell out of the bag. With that said, this is still a 5 star purchase and are going to strongly feature this winter!
review.name: Amazing overalls

review.reviewBody: They are so cozy comfy and warm. And super cute. Love all the pockets and the drawstrings at the ankles. Perfect for chilly fall days or apres. I got so many compliments and people asking where I got them. Backcountry baby. You need these.
review.name: Get them

review.reviewBody: I think these fit true to size. I'm 5'5" and wear a medium and I felt like there was a little extra room, just enough to be super cozy. But lengthwise, they were perfect. The fleece looks a little tattered out of the box, so not super impressed with the flat loft instead of fluffy softness. Has the look of worn, washed and returned.. but still dog them. I'd buy again.
review.name: So comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Very disappointed with the pocket depth.  My phone does not actually fit all the way down into the side pockets.  These are not rugged construction either.  the draw cords are the type that wear out fairly quickly.  
It is insulting that these are marketed toward outdoorsy women and the pockets still have no depth.  Only the back (transparent) pockets have any depth, if you want everything on display.

As someone who wears men's pants for work, I hoped that buying women's pants from an outdoor company, the pockets would be just as good.  very disappointed.
review.name: Pockets are "girl Pockets", not rugged

review.reviewBody: These are the coziest overalls I've ever worn. There are a lot of pockets so I could carry all of the things I need on me. I try to carry a bag because I always leave it behind. The waist adjustment allowed me to cinch the waist to look more flattering. I am only 5'2" but being able to cinch the leg openings also helped so they weren't too long on me. I will be wearing these all winter long.
review.name: Coziest Overalls!

name: Wander Pile-Fleece Overall - Women's

hasVariant.name: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 18oz
hasVariant.description: Buy the LifeStraw Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 18oz online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 18oz
review.reviewBody: I bought this bottle with plans to use it at Disney. I have only tested this on 2 sources of water at home; city tap water and filtered fridge water. While both have improved taste, I can still identify the city water. For those interested, this bottle holds 19. 3 oz water when filled at the max line and due to the length of the straw, there is 1. 48 oz of undrinkable water, leaving you with ~17. 8 oz of filtered water. When filled, it weighs ~2lb, 3oz- so keep that in mind if you’re backpacking. I hope this bottle makes the swampy Florida water drinkable at Disney. Otherwise, I don’t think I would purchase again.
review.name: Water still has a “taste”

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 18oz
review.reviewBody: I feel I can drink water anywhere on my travels with this water bottle. It is abit hard to sip from but I feel it is doing a super job of filtering.
review.name: Trustworthy water bottle

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 18oz
review.reviewBody: I bought it as a backup replacement, not that I needed it, but I know me, and I know I should have on handy. But, it is the exact same one that comes on the bottle, so I know it is as good as it gets!
review.name: Purchased just in case. . .

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 18oz
review.reviewBody: It’s hard to draw through. I guess it’s because of the filter media.
review.name: It’s hard to draw through.

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 18oz
review.reviewBody: I’m really enjoying this lifeStraw knowing that the water I’m putting in it almost anywhere I go is transformed into safe healthy, “good” drinking water.
review.name: I’m really enjoying this lifeStraw

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 18oz
review.reviewBody:
This is our second stainless steel Lifestraw purchase and we love it. The peace of mind it provides when we travel to foreign countries is well worth it. We haven’t used it for camping yet but know we will be soon…

.
review.name: Highly Recommend

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 18oz
review.reviewBody: I’m sure this is a great product, but I had a really hard time sucking water out of the nozzle thing and the day I was testing it, I just didn’t drink enough water. Also, quite heavy.
review.name: Good product, not for me

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 18oz
review.reviewBody:
The Go Stainless Steal 18 oz bottle works great. Unfortunately, I have a few issues with it. I bought it to use in the hospital, where I've spent many months with my husband. I was hoping to use it for both of us to filter water to drink there, as their water is horrible. Since it filters the water on the way out, you can’t pour the filtered water into another cup. :( Also, I love ice water, with the filter unless you have crushed ice you can’t use ice in the bottle due to the filter going down the middle of the bottle. As, both of these characteristics are important to me, it was somewhat of a disappointment. 

On the positive side the water taste great and I drank more water in the past week at the hospital than probably in the past three months my husband was an inpatient in critical condition. He just went through a heart and kidney transplant, due to his his in the service, with multiple complications. At this point we do not have the ability to buy a second bottle.

I do appreciation your company and what you are doing. Thanks for helping out those who need it most.
review.name: LifeStraw Go Series Stainless Steel 18 oz Review

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 18oz
review.reviewBody: I've been using my Lifestraw bottle for a few months now, and here are my observations: PROS: I like that I'm removing micro-plastics from my drinking water, for daily use at home, and that I can travel anywhere, and use tap water safely and eliminate single-use plastic bottle usage. CONS: I don't like / find inconvenient the following: 1) The separate screw-on lid. When I leave it off, I find water pulls up through the straw and spills around the bottle on its own. This is really inconvenient because I leave the bottle uncovered most of the time while at home/in a hotel room. I mean, I don't want to be fiddling around with unscrewing a lid in the middle of the night when I wakeup and want a sip of water. 2) It's really heavy - as in, literally gives me a sore shoulder when carrying it around. 3) The bottle size is too wide to fit into any car cup / bottle holder, except for one strap carrier with adjustable straps.
review.name: Commitment to purified water

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 18oz
review.reviewBody: I love that I now have a water bottle that keeps my water cold! My only issue is that the top is separate from the bottle and will make it easier to lose. Otherwise, I’m happy with it.
review.name: I love that I now

name: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 18oz

review.reviewBody: I just received the backpack a few hours ago today and tried it going outdoor activities with the backpack with gears and clothings in it. It was super comfy, not distrubing while running and hiking. One thing I found was that it gets a bit narrow on the bottom of the backpack so it would not be as convenience if you put like a rectangular things, but it's just my experience so yours may not be like this. I highly recommend this backpack other than any backpacks as of its durabilty and comfortness it gives with a sufficient room for things to be packed up nicely.
review.name: Trillblazer 30

review.reviewBody: Thin straps, uncomfortable with a full pack. Hip belt more like a stabilizer. You have to sag bag pretty low to get any weight on hips. Useful bag, but not perfect
review.name: Thin shoulder straps

review.reviewBody: Love this bag! I even use it for my urban hiking, to and from work. Great pockets and very light weight. My only issue is that the this year the straps don't have a loops to pull excess straps into.
review.name: Great pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit. Very comfortable. Love how quickly it dries.
review.name: Great underwear.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Substantial and warm and breathable. So much better than cotton!
review.name: The best undies

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Amazing. I wish I would have discovered this option sooner. I'm a 32 DDD and I ordered the large in the top and bottom and they work well. I am ordering another color
review.name: Using as a swimsuit paired with the icebreaker siren bra

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these - they stay put, they are comfortable and they last. I wish they came in more "fun" colors like coral or teal. How about a discount when you buy 3 in any color not just black or tan?
review.name: Upgrading my top drawer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The quality is good, the sizing is on a looser side. The color is truly beautiful. Washes easily in the laundry machine. The return process here is super easy (I kept this pair, but returned another one) so try and see for yourself.
review.name: good item

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these for travel because you can wash and they dry overnight. They take so little space in a suitcase compared to cotton. They're very comfortable. Nice and unusual color, too. Happy I bought them!
review.name: Excellent Bikini Underwear!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these, I already have the matching bra and 1 pair that I got to try. I grabbed 2 more pair on clearance.
review.name: Second Purchase

review.reviewBody: It's unfortunate how pricey these are, because they are super comfortable. They fit well and the color is nice. They are also unraveling a little already, after not much wear. So overall disappointed, considering how expensive they are.
review.name: Comfortable but not worth the price

review.reviewBody: Wanted to love these material is great hence 2 stars construction is 0. Even asked if I got a defective batch. Gusset is too small and far back won't cover any lady bits just your butthole bad fit.
review.name: Made for long torsos

review.reviewBody: It's been YEARS of complaints about the small gusset, IB. I will no longer purchase your underwear until a gusset redesign is performed.
review.name: Again with the small gusset

name: Siren Bikini Underwear - Women's

review.reviewBody: I like them. They're well made. The cut is a little funky! And they run LARGE. Beware. Order at least one size down,
review.name: Tough shorts that run big

review.reviewBody: I bought a large…these would easily be XXL
review.name: Way too big

review.reviewBody: If you do not mind making your own drawstring thru the waist they are pretty great.. But there is that. I've done it to each of the three and they are my favorite shorts... But worthless if you do not modify them.
review.name: Eh

review.reviewBody: No belt loops or tie string and the elastic waist band  is cheap/weak.
review.name: nice fabric, poorly made

review.reviewBody: These are comfortable and well made shorts, but they fit horribly. Bought according to the size guide, but they're baggy and start to fall off with any weight in the pockets or after walking more than a few dozen yards. The description is wrong, though, as they do NOT have a drawcord. If these had a drawcord or belt loops they'd be 5 stars, but without I can't recommend them at all.
review.name: Well made, bad fit, not as described

review.reviewBody: Nice shorts that run big. Waist was big, fit my legs OK
review.name: Nice well made heavy weight shorts

review.reviewBody: Great bag. Perfect for when the airport wants to slam my luggage around. Look luck getting through this one. Definitely reliably sturdy and comfortable.
review.name: The best of the best of the best, sir

review.reviewBody: This bag is so spacious and the color is very cool. I plan to use this on my upcoming trip to Ecuador and the Galápagos Islands.
review.name: Allpa 38L Roller Bag

review.reviewBody: Love this bag, I got it in all black. It is perfect for that long weekend away. Fits great in the overhead storage compartment on the plane.
review.name: Love this bag, I got

review.reviewBody: Well designed, has lots of room. I like that there are handles/holds on all sides which makes it easier to lift and move around. Rigid enough to hold it's shape, but I like that it's not a hard case so you can squish it a bit to fit in your trunk or an overhead compartment if needed
review.name: What you need out of a roller bag

review.reviewBody: This seems like an excellent bag. Just completed a 5 to 7 day trip and it held up well as checked luggage. Though it’s small enough that it easily could be a carry-on. Also like the organization. Overall great bag.
review.name: Allpa roller bag

review.reviewBody: Perfect size for a minimalist traveler. Love the colors and details of this carry-on roller bag. It seems really sturdy and well made. Looking forward to using it buy next abroad trip.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody:
Pros:
- Excellent quality
- Spacious design

Cons:
- may not work as a cabin bag for some airlines
review.name: Excellent quality and spacious!

review.reviewBody: Love, love this duffel. Compartments make it easy to keep stuff organized. Have a black hole Patagonia roller duffel that I have been using; but after seeing the Cotopaxi Alpha roller, I knew I wanted it; love that nido bag fits perfectly in the outside zipper pocket. Best duffel for travel, even bought the 45L duffel as well
review.name: Best duffel ever

review.reviewBody: The bag came as described. The build quality and materials used are high end. The color contrast inside the bag and mesh to hold items in place is perfect. Handle seems sturdy and as it will stand the test of time.
review.name: Great Bag

review.reviewBody: If this bag is as good as the backpack and larger wheeler it will be amazing! If I could redesign I would add the computer compartment like on backpack and sleeve so I could stack on larger wheeler that’s the only miss I see!
review.name: Great bag

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Not a max cushioned shoe. Not too comfortable. Insole is very thin. Replaced with a better insole.
review.name: Good grip

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: One day in Universal Studios and I’m glad I bought them.  Incredible support.
review.name: Need comfort?

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent fit and support. Color combination looks great!
review.name: Perfect
comment: Thank you for the excellent review!

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was very pleased with the MTL Long Sky 2.  These fit me much better than the Moab Speed, which was narrow for my foot.  I love the tongue design of the shoe as it adds great stability on technical terrain.  I've used these for hiking, but am not a trail runner, so I cannot comment on how they work for running.  I definitely would recommend for hiking and casual use
review.name: Nice, all around hiker

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Use this mainly for trail and some road running. Very comfortable running shoe.   Had to buy longer laces to be able to lace up the trainer.

After approximately 400km both shoes are torn at the point where the toeguard is attached to the upper mesh at the toebox.  The tread is fairly well worn compared to other similar shoes.  Not impressed for a shoe at this price.
review.name: Great shoe, doesn't last!

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love these. They have a built in arch so I didn't have to add insoles. I am wearing them a lot!
review.name: Perfect for my feet.

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good runner that is good around town. I live in the humid South and these shoes are cool.
review.name: Good trail runner

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I use this exclusively for running technical and shorter trails (under 12 miles) in the PNW, and they work awesome. I would not recommend them for running distance or for fire roads as the midsole is not very cushioned. Highly recommend.
review.name: No complaints for shorter runs

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have a few changes that need to be made about this upper.   I know you make the Matyrx upper, but this product should not be left behind.   I can take most of my shoes both trail and road to 500+ miles before I have major upper issues, but this one wasn’t even close.  Sub 100 miles I had a hole on my right pinky toe.   It has since widened now that I’m passed 150.  

Now what I love about this shoe and it looks like these are different on the matryx upper.   The lock down with the guile style laces is amazing, nothing works that well for me.  The breathability is also amazing although the inner mess could be a bit more fine to block sand.  The outer mesh needs strengthened.   I’d like to see it stay mesh though, it works extremely well.   Midsole/outsole for what it’s designed for it perfect.   It gives a very fast nimble feel that gives me confidence to rock hop down fast rocky terrain.   With the cut outs it can take some rock hits from the perfect sized rock/root, but mostly protective.   The outsole has a good thickness to absorb impact, and the cutouts are small enough to get around larger rocks, bigger enough not trap tiny rocks, and allows great flexiblity around the outsole.   The durability of the upper though.   Drops the shoe to a 6 from a 9
review.name: I want to love it BUT…

review.itemreviewed: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This is a great shoe: it’s light, well-ventilated, stable, and grippy.  The insole isn’t as cushioned or thick as the Agility Peak 5, but it feels more connected to the Earth.  This really is a purpose built trail runner.  Sure, it can do mall or casual duty.  But it’s meant for the trail.  The outsole is soft, grippy rubber.  But beware: much like sticky, high performance tires these soles wear out a bit faster on concrete and asphalt than shoes with a harder rubber.  There’s always trade offs, but for this one you get great grip.  The shoe is also visually striking and appealing.

My only reservation is price.  But if you can find it on sale you’ll get a great bargain.
review.name: Great trail shoe.
comment: We value and appreciate your feedback! Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts.

name: Mtl Long Sky 2 Trail Running Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.name: Polaris Optifuel (Canister & Multi-Liquid Fuel)
hasVariant.description: Buy the Optimus Polaris Optifuel (Canister & Multi-Liquid Fuel) online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I am so tired of paying more for less......This stove is very nice to used because you have options.  However, you now have to pay $200 for a stove that was once $140 and now it doesn't include the fuel bottle to burn the liquid fuel.
review.name: Disappointed !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

review.reviewBody: Ease of use,  Always started up, No leaks or fuel spills.  I used the pot with the fins on the bottom and I was boiling water over twice as fast as the guys using jetboils in cold and warmer temps.  The burner fit in the Xpress HE pot no problem.  Oh just one thing.  Dump the bendable heat shield and get a fold-able rigid heat/wind blocker.  Makes life easier in windy and deep snow areas.
review.name: -30C No Problem, Clean and reliable

review.reviewBody: The Optimus Polaris will run on white gas or any size of fuel canisters. Also, one jet any fuel allows you to burn white gas, gasoline, kerosene or diesel if you’re in a pinch. Where this stove can really shine is the 4 season mode with a canister. I like the tool that allows you to service the stove if needed. Furthermore, the tool is magnetic and cleans the burner jet while cooking if required. It also comes with a heat reflector and a windscreen for better performance and efficiency. This stove is a plug and get cooking type of stove. I would recommend this stove for single or group adventures.
review.name: Great design simple to operate

review.reviewBody: The Optifuel stove puts out the heat. The regulator provides ultimate control from a low simmer to max BTUs. Being able to use this stove with isopropane and liquid fuels is a huge advantage. Used the stove for the first time on an adventure that started out warm and then later snowed during the trip. Used the stove to cook for 4 and had no problems.
review.name: Versatile workhorse of a stove

review.reviewBody: I have used the stove for a few years now and it always works. It's  a flawless piece of machinery.  I use medium pots for most of my cooking and it a perfect fit for the stove.
review.name: Still working

review.reviewBody: I can't think of anything I don't like about this stove. It's easy to set up, can use just about any fuel, and it's more compact than other stoves I own. Highly recommended.
review.name: Well made, versatile and easy to use

review.reviewBody: It's lightweight and efficiently bring things to temperature you need!

I had a little trouble getting it it start and stay lit with canister fuel when new. Once I used it a couple times, it works like a champ.  I've found it best to start with the canister right-side-up, then invert (if needed).
review.name: Great stove.

review.reviewBody:
I got this stove because I wanted a reliable stove that I never had to worry about finding fuel for. For that purpose it is great. The flame controls work well, it cooks well, and it boils water fast. 


However, if I know you I can get fuel canisters and it's going to be warm, it's hard for me to recommend bringing this over a tiny canister stove because they are so much lighter and smaller (environmental impact of tough to recycle single use fuel canisters aside).
review.name: Great stove

review.reviewBody:
Being able to use any fuel available is a really nice feature to have, and not have to change jets to do it. I live in Alaska, I might not have a store with gas canisters in stock anywhere nearby. But there will always be diesel, gasoline, or white gas/kerosene etc available guaranteed. 

Given that it is multi-fuel compatible without a jet change, it's probably not as fuel efficient as other brands. BUT, I've cooked for approximately 5 hours continuously using gasoline in the bottle it came with and still had fuel left. You can boil a LOT of water with 5 hours worth minimum of liquid fuel. 

Being able to clean the jet without moving the system, while it's cooking... is also cool. 

It all fits (minus the fuel bottle) in a 1600ml pot, so it's fairly space efficient.

It's extremely easy to use, the bottle doesn't leak, and it cooks really well. I carry the bottle of liquid fuel and a gas canister with me as a backup, and feel very confident with this system in the backcountry.
review.name: Versatile System

name: Polaris Optifuel (Canister & Multi-Liquid Fuel)
