review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm writer for my fussy husband. He loves this. His old rain jacket is heavy and the gortex is worn out.
review.name: Well thought out design.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great lightweight jacket my go to for most occasions. Works great to block wind and water along with stylish amd comfortable to wear.
review.name: Game changer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I own several Marmot jackets, all size large. This jacket is grossly oversized. Order one size smaller
review.name: Grossly oversized !!
comment:
Hello,
Thank you for providing us with feedback on the product.

We are sorry to hear that the sizing of the Hoody has not met your expectations.

We hope the smaller size of the ROM Hoody will fit you perfectly!

Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via [URL-https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us] or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9am-5pm Eastern Time.
Thank you! Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This a lightweight garment that protects from wind, perfect for cool weather, and for a layer in colder weather. I like that it is colorful (mine is teal and purple). It seems this will last well.
review.name: Looks good, seems durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great coat. Really breathable and keeps snow out on long snowy touring ventures. Really happy with the material. Recommend this to everyone and I like the funky 90’s looking color scheme.
review.name: Great Breathable coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have an older version of this jacket, I think and it's my go to jacket most of the time, it's just a great jacket. I thought this might be a newer version of my current older Windstopper Gore jacket. I'm disappointed that none of the new jackets have any sort of reflective material on them. Also, many of the newer jackets don't have Velcro wrist adjustment which I miss because I'm a woman who prefers men's jackets/clothes most of the time for the fit and colors so my arms are a bit shorter and the velcro closure helps keep the sleeve up. That being said, I do not like velcro closure on the body because it always wants to snag up your sweater or shirt. I did not like the feel of this jacket so I returned it. I love Marmot and picked a different jacket.
review.name: Not What I Expected
comment:
Hello,
Thank you for your feedback on our jacket. 

We are very sorry to hear that the features of the item did not meet your expectations.
We will make sure to forward your idea regarding the reflective material and the feedback to the appropriate department so that we can consider an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9am-5pm Eastern Time.
Thank you! Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really like it although it is not so warm as expected
review.name: Like it

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Such an amazing shell! Firstly, the colors are unparalleled - there hasn't been a day of me wearing it in the wild where someone hasn't taken the time to compliment the colors.

Performance is superb. It's incredibly breathable, but yet warm when needed. I bought this as a shell to wear one long multi-pitch routes. So for no obvious signs of wear despite heavy and constant abrasion against the hard quartzite of NC. 20/10 would recommend this to anyone!
review.name: Unparalleled shell for climbing

name: ROM Softshell Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great for comfort and excellent quality   This is my 2nd pie because I won’t go anywhere else
review.name: Amazing Buy!

review.reviewBody: Waterproof and Steel toe it's a working boot for my husband!!
review.name: Style and colors

review.reviewBody: Most comfortable boots I’ve ever worn….stylish and beautiful design.  Perfect fit…Love the roper style heel.  Would highly recommend.  Also a very reasonable price.
review.name: Ariat Western Rambler Boot

review.reviewBody: Very good quality boot. Very durable. Looks great and feels great wearing them all day
review.name: Best boot for daily wear

review.reviewBody:
Brilliant work horses and daily drivers. Rough to break in but once done simply awesome!
I have them in rotation but wear them daily!
review.name: Daily drivers!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and look great. However I've only had these for about 8 months and the sole is already separating. I do not wear these often and they never see work or anything other than casual use. Bought them on vacation in gatlinburg so of course I no longer have the recipt or ability to go back to thw store they were purchased from.
review.name: Comfortable, not durable
comment: Thank you for your feedback on these boots. We so appreciate you taking the time to leave a review. Look out for an email from us where we can further discuss this issue. We’re here to help!

review.reviewBody: I've had these around 3 months now and they are a great day to day boot. The first couple of times I ended up with a blister, but I think that was down to the wrong socks. I did change the insoles which has definitely helped with wearing them for longer periods.  They look worn in, and great with a nice pair of bootcut jeans.
review.name: A good day to day boot

review.reviewBody:
This is an amazing boot for the buck. Sturdy enough for working in the yard and dressed enough to take out on the town.

My new daily driver!
review.name: What a fantastic boot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my second pair. The best thing I can say about them is that I put over 15,000 steps in on the second day I wore them and my feet feel great.
review.name: Excellent comfort

review.reviewBody: Love these boots! I wear them nearly every day! They look professional while being rugged enough to work in. Great for outside work, office work, or a night on the town. 10/10 recommend!
review.name: The all around town boot!

review.reviewBody: This has become my favorite long-sleeve base layer. Not quite sure what separates virgin merino wool from traditional merino wool but I know it's soft and love how form-fitting it feels. Love the weight especially for springs skiing. Great cut for me; I went with a large, I'm athletic 6' 180lbs with broader upper body and wouldn't want it to fit any other way. Good idea to buy a specific wool wash like Nikwax or another brand if you don't have any on hand.
review.name: New Favorite Base Layer

review.itemreviewed: Powderbug Plus II Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality but tight and narrow inside. I ordered up one size to accommodate for the tightness inside. Length of boot is true to size. Keeps feet warm and dry.
review.name: Great but a little narrow fit

review.itemreviewed: Powderbug Plus II Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They are so lovely and confortable! My kid really love them and used it all the time in the snow.
review.name: Excellent product

review.itemreviewed: Powderbug Plus II Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Hard to put on, had to return. Toddler daughter had a tough time walking in them as well.

comment: We are sorry to hear that this did not meet your expectations! We want to help you find something that works for you. Please contact our Customer Care team at 1 (800) 622-6953.

review.itemreviewed: Powderbug Plus II Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very good and comfortable shoes. My son loves it. He  is winter ready
review.name: Winter ready

review.itemreviewed: Powderbug Plus II Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are great boots!! I looked all over for quality boots and these are it for sure!!
review.name: Toddler winter boots

review.itemreviewed: Powderbug Plus II Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: I bought these a couple months early in preparation for a trip to the snow. I knew my son was a size 5, so I didn’t bother to try them on. Absolutely could NOT get his foot into the boot with the liners in. Pulled them out, and tried to put them on like socks before putting them in the boot. The liners probably equated a size 3. There was no way my son’s foot was getting in them. We ended up doing multiple layers of socks, and that seem to work. The outer shell of the boots is super sturdy. Columbia just needs to get their sizing right. I wish I would’ve tried them on sooner, because now I am out of my return window.
review.name: Good boots, not so good liners

review.itemreviewed: Powderbug Plus II Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Size up. My 2yo wears a size 5 in regular shoes/slippers. These boots in size 7 fit her perfect with room for thick socks
review.name: Size up!!

review.itemreviewed: Powderbug Plus II Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: These are impossible to get on. In theory they are great, however, when you're trying to get these on a wiggling toddler they are not practical. I have 20 month old twin boys and the time and energy it takes to get them into these is not worth it.
review.name: Not toddler friendly

review.itemreviewed: Powderbug Plus II Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Do not buy! Could not get my kids foot in. Super stiff. Plus a protruding piece of plastic in the front by the ankle in both boots. The insert is extremely difficult to put back in. I can’t believe this is a Columbia product.
review.name: Do not recommend

review.itemreviewed: Powderbug Plus II Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: I could not get this on my child's foot. They seem like good quality, but it was so tight I couldn't get them even close to on.
review.name: Too Small

review.itemreviewed: Mezcal III G2.0 4C XC Trail 29in Tire
review.reviewBody: Rolls super fast and climbs well.  Rode Mezcal F/R in Marji Gesick this year.  No flats and plenty of grip.
review.name: Great XC and endurance tire!

review.itemreviewed: Mezcal III G2.0 4C XC Trail 29in Tire
review.reviewBody:
I admit I purchased these tires because I thought they were beautiful. Perfect sidewall color (better looking than the light or dark Maxxis tanwalls), nice graphics, Italian style (and I like Vittoria road tires). The price point was attractive as well as the low weight of these tires. As advertized, the Mezcals roll fast and are very efficient.  They are absolutely perfect for racing or seeking Strava KOMs or PRs on hardpack dirt (I've gotten several with them).  The almost solid center bead makes them incredibly efficient on pavement as well for a 2.2" mtb tire. But I have to say that unless one cares exclusively about the fine qualities mentioned above, these tires do not have great merit. Here's why: 
What surprised me most about the Mezcals is how hard they feel. The recommended lowest pressure is 29 psi. I ran them at 23 and still they were not very comfortable. I didn't dare go lower because of the worry of the lightweight/thin sidewall. Moreover, while they are efficient in perfect hardpack conditions, they are not very grippy in any other conditions. 
I've been rolling Maxxis 2.3 Ikon's on my hardtail carbon Niner Air 9 for years. They roll almost as fast as the Mezcals on pavement and hardpack but are much more comfortable and much grippier in a variety of terrains and weather conditions. I have a set of 2.0 Specialized Ground Controls on another hardtail that are more comfortable and more grippy then the Mezcals as well. My guess is that the rubber is just too hard. I got caught out in a crazy thunderstorm on the Mezcals and felt like I was wearing roller skates on an ice rink--all while my son riding Minions could stay on the trail just fine (he just might be a better rider than me too...). 
So I'll probably take these off and store them for some perfect race conditions. But I doubt I'll really ever put them back on. Time to go back to the Ikon, even if it doesn't look as cool and costs a little more.
review.name: Tire as adverstized

review.itemreviewed: Mezcal III G2.0 4C XC Trail 29in Tire
review.reviewBody: put this tire on and was pleased with performance up until about the 12 mile mark on its maiden voyage when the tire blew out with a cut right in the middle of the tread, okay, crap happens, replaced with brand new tire - the very next weekend about 6 miles in the tire went flat again with a cut in the middle of the tread. For me, this is unacceptable, would never buy this tire again!!! the poor durability screams ride me in the sand where there are no rocks, roots or anything that remotely sharp, because you may need to walk it in, not for me
review.name: fast, but not very durable
comment:
Hi Brian, Sorry these tires didn't work out for you.  Let us know if we can help set up an exchange for you.
Cheers, Eric

review.itemreviewed: Mezcal III G2.0 4C XC Trail 29in Tire
review.reviewBody: This tire is an ideal fit for me.  Love the 2.35 width.  Perfect balance between light weight efficient hardpack roller and a soft grippy single track tire that bites on just about everything.  I've used it to test durability twice now on the 350 mile Huracan course in central FL. No complaints at all. It even aired up and grabbed the rim and sealed with a hand pump.  A great do it all tire in my book
review.name: Superb, Durable tire

review.itemreviewed: Mezcal III G2.0 4C XC Trail 29in Tire
review.reviewBody: I went from 2.4 maxxis rekons to 2.35 mezcals. I have been running them for about 5 months now. First thing I notcied was how much faster they rolled compared to the rekons while not sacrificing any of the grippyness. Not great in the slop but are absolute rockets everywhere else. I have had a few punctures due to thorns but nothings stans cant fix. Putting them on was a bit difficult but that is probably due to my skill. Overall a great tire for xc racing and riding.
review.name: best tire

review.itemreviewed: Mezcal III G2.0 4C XC Trail 29in Tire
review.reviewBody: If you want a tire that measures as advertised, dont buy this particular model and size. I have ordered from three different places and came with the same issue. Measured 2.1???, not even 2.2 . I went back to Continentals.
review.name: 29 x 2.35 Not True to Size

review.itemreviewed: Mezcal III G2.0 4C XC Trail 29in Tire
review.reviewBody:
Take my review as a grain of salt, but I put these on a Giant Talon 2 29er with a 21mm Rim. Seem to be a perfect fit. Came from a Maxxis Ikon 2.20 so not a huge size difference but the tread pattern has immediately proved to be a huge benefit. Less slipping on climbs and can feel them digging into the dirt on every corner. I'll also add maybe because of how new they are but now I need to buy some fenders as these things kick dirt/sand up like crazy which lets me know they are doing their job. 
Went with a "Barzo Mullet" setup, (Mezcal in Back and Barzo in Front) Love the grey sidewalls as well.
review.name: Sexy AF

review.itemreviewed: Mezcal III G2.0 4C XC Trail 29in Tire
review.reviewBody: Sidewall durability issue.  Will try an inside patch job cause it's new, bummer.
review.name: Buy the regular one.

review.itemreviewed: Mezcal III G2.0 4C XC Trail 29in Tire
review.reviewBody: Awesome, confident tire for mixed terrain -- single-track, rocks, dirt, gravel.  (Wouldn't use them if a route involved much pavement.)  Easy to mount tubelessly with floor pump and pressing bead in by hand.  Held air perfectly. Beefy enough for a loaded bikepacking rig.  I sized down from a 3" Bontrager to the 2.6" Mezcal without sacrificing grip or squish, but gained speed and stability/tracking.... these tires go where you point them and grip well whether going up or down.
review.name: Great All-'Rounder

review.itemreviewed: Mezcal III G2.0 4C XC Trail 29in Tire
review.reviewBody: I like the round profile because the shape performs well on rock features.  I also find these tires hold well on kitty litter type soil, roll smooth and hold up well.  Good tire for dry conditions.
review.name: Rock

name: Mezcal III G2.0 4C XC Trail 29in Tire

review.reviewBody:
I bought this pack a little over a month ago to be a low profile pack that I can every day carry to work either in my truck where it sits in my passenger seat or when I take the train into work. It’s great, well made, handsome and fits my yeti coffee cup in the side pocket perfectly and very securely. If the only thing it did was carry my coffee, I’d be happy, but it has pockets for my ever expanding gear that I carry and the pack shapes nicely with the small dry bag that I keep inside it. The quality of workmanship and design details are superb and even though it’s a humble pack compared to the rest of Mystery Ranch’s packs, it’s a contender! 
  I was super stoked that I got this pack just a few days after ordering it and I haven’t left home without it ever since. 
Brilliantly done Mystery Ranch! 
Oh yeah, I also use it as a stuff sack/organizer inside my MR Blitz 30 when out on a ruck in the Cascade Mountains.
review.name: My sidekick

review.reviewBody: just got back from a week of long hikes, bikes & climbs & I had one of these strapped on for all of it. I've never had good experiences with packable day bags but I'm glad I gave this one a shot because it was excellent! super comfortable all day & weighs basically nothing. Comfortable even with 2L of water & some gear! also of course it seems to be indestructible
review.name: how is the bag this comfortable?

review.reviewBody: I'm currently in italy and love the light weight pack.
review.name: Great backpack

review.reviewBody:
Let me tell you, folks, they don’t want you to know about the Mystery Ranch In and Out 19. I’m talking government-level secrecy. I’m talking Roswell, Area 51, men-in-black-staring-at-you-from-the-corner-of-the-parking-lot levels of conspiracy. But guess what? I’ve got the truth right here, strapped to my back, and it’s lightweight, packable, and potentially from another dimension.

The Mystery Ranch In and Out 19 doesn’t just carry your gear—it carries the burden of knowledge that we’re not alone. This 19-liter wonder was clearly designed by extraterrestrials, likely reverse-engineered from UFO wreckage they found near a New Mexico desert. I mean, how else can you explain its otherworldly design and functionality?

Exhibit A: The material is lightweight but suspiciously durable. It’s almost like they blended carbon nanotubes with alien alloys, then wrapped it in something soft to the touch but strong enough to fend off intergalactic threats (or at least some thorny brush on a hike). No mere earthbound polymer could achieve this. I’ve seen classified files about “advanced textiles,” but nothing like this.

Exhibit B: It packs into itself! Yeah, that’s right. You’re telling me this thing can fold down smaller than my government-issued UFO tracker? Tell me that’s normal. It’s like it knows when I need it. One second it's a full-on hiking pack, the next it vanishes into thin air, tucked away in my glovebox like some sort of interdimensional artifact. It’s compact, inconspicuous, and probably has a secret compartment to hold alien documents or, you know, snacks.

Exhibit C: The breathability. Who thought of this? Who decided, “Hey, let’s make the straps so light that you barely feel them”? It’s like the pack was designed for those extra-terrestrial beings who travel faster than light and don’t need sweaty backs weighing them down during long-distance abductions. Forget NASA. This is the real space-age technology.

Exhibit D: The 19 liters. Nineteen liters is exactly what you need to carry provisions for an extended alien stakeout. I checked the math. You could carry binoculars, a flask, some tinfoil hats, a radar detector, and still have room for an X-Files box set in there. It’s almost like the designers knew what we’d be up to.

Let’s talk pockets. The stretchy side pocket—definitely designed for holding alien energy crystals, but they also fit a water bottle. Coincidence? I think not. And the zippered top pocket? Perfect size for your intergalactic passport or, you know, an energy bar if you’re on a terrestrial hike.

I was on a “recon mission” (aka hiking in the woods, totally normal), and the pack just molded to me. No bouncing, no shifting. Almost like it was communicating with my back. Are we looking at advanced alien ergonomics? Almost definitely.Conclusion: The Mystery Ranch In and Out 19 backpack is the smoking gun of outdoor gear. Sure, it looks like just another backpack—that’s what they want you to think. But for those in the know, it’s a clear sign that they’re out there, sharing their technology with us, one ultralight, ultra-packable backpack at a time.

In summary, if you're looking for a pack that combines cutting-edge tech with probable alien origins, look no further. Just be careful. I’m pretty sure the moment I bought it, a black SUV started following me. 

Coincidence? I’ll let you decide.
review.name: *TOP SECRET REVIEW* CLEARANCE REQUIRED

review.reviewBody: My wife and I wanted something for an upcoming trip to Disney world to put our rain jackets, water and snacks in. This pack was perfect, it folds up small enough to put in our luggage and was comfortable enough to wear all day every day. There is plenty of storage for day trips. We got the blaze orange one so it was easier to find each other in the crowds of people. Also I will be using it on my upcoming scouting trips for hunting season! Perfect all around bag.
review.name: Perfect travel bag

review.reviewBody: My new favorite: lightweight, lots of storage, comfortable and stylish.
review.name: Lightweight

review.reviewBody:
This day-pack is my favorite, I've used it for for traveling in Europe, Australia, and elsewhere. One of the best features is that it folds into its own front pocket, which I absolutely love for plane travel. Yet it's huge when you need it to be, and cinches small when you only have minimal things to carry.

The backpack offers plenty of storage and has space for a bladder, as well as a bottle. It's incredibly lightweight, possessing all the right features you need without any unnecessary extras. Just a thoughtful design...
review.name: My favorite travel day pack

review.reviewBody: The color is so different than the lilac it was supposed to be on the photos that I am disappointed. It is rather grey than lilac. If I would have known, I would have picked a different color. :-(
review.name: Nothing like the photos

review.reviewBody:
I've been using this daily for 3 years and here are my takeaways.

- The straps have a suggestion of padding but it doesn't do anything. They're not at all rigid and frequently get twisted up.
- The top pocket is just big enough for a protein bar and keys, not much more.
- Too small for most things, but also too big for use in the city (you might as well get a fanny pack or a bigger backpack).
- the mesh rips easily.
- the elastic on top of the water bottle pocket is too strong and thick, it makes it so you can't easily get a water bottle in/out of there. Also too small for a nalgene.
- the mesh pocket on the front fits a nalgene, but then you lose use of that pocket.
- the novelty of having a stowable backpack fades as soon as you realize that the chances of you using the backpack for that purpose are next to zero, unless you're specifically looking for a backpack with these features.
- the synch straps are awkwardly placed and hard to tighten/loosen.
- there's plenty of places to put stuff on the outside of the backpack, but when it comes to actually putting anything there it just doesn't work really well.

This backpack is pretty much built to not be used, or to make it look like you go outside when you really don't.
review.name: Does everything a jansport does, but worse.

review.reviewBody: This is definitely the best 19 liter pack there is! I bought this for day-hikes, and it is well worth the price. If you are looking for a small pack, I would definitely tell you to buy this one!
review.name: Best Small Pack!

name: In & Out 19L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I had the low version of these for a while and really liked them. I wanted something a little more comfy for multi pitch routes and decided to pick up a slightly bigger pair of these. Even with the extra room I can climb just as hard in these as I can the lows and my feet are no longer suffering on pitch 3. review.reviewBody: ***6 month update- the Altura has held up well. BUT, maybe I?m just a light climber but the break in period was long. They are still stiff and not at all sensitive on smears/edges. I wear a 42 in Miura and love that shoe more than any other. These jam really well but don?t edge or face climb well at all for me. I feel clunky in them even 6 months later. I bought a 9.5 and probably could?ve gone 1/2 size down. I plan to re sole these and expect them to give a little at that point, but all in all they?re a quality stiff trad shoe.
review.name: Quality stiff trad shoe-

review.reviewBody: Won't buy this style again.  For such an expensive pant, these are not comfortable or what I expected. They fit much smaller than Mountain Hardware's other leggings and while the fabric on the back is a soft legging material, the front is not and is different and uncomfortable and easily stain.
review.name: Small fit and uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: The material of this tight is like a wet suit, not comfortable to put on. The medium size was to small. For these reasons I returned the Chockstone trail tights.
review.name: Uncomfortable material

review.reviewBody: I own probably 12 pairs of MH pants- all size small. My favorite style is the high waisted Dynama 2 ankle pants. I also own the stretchy athletic type pants, but these were way too small and the fabric was very restrictive. Very disappointed. The small was way too small.
review.name: Tight and not like their other pants

review.reviewBody: just tight enough to be fine, and never went down when trail running - i'm 5f4 and 155 pounds - a little belly -
review.name: really wonderful green

review.reviewBody:
Love the product
But it ran really small. I ordered the next size up and am totally satisfied.
review.name: Transition leggings

review.reviewBody: I am picky about my clothes, so when I love it, I really love it.  These tights are the perfect black base to any wardrobe.  practical, flattering, and comfortable.  Most of my wardrobe is neutral with a lot of black, but try the other colors.  I bought these in Black and the Dark Marsh Scattered Print which is a dark blue, and love both very much.  Great for outdoors and indoors while being so stylish.  Redoing my wardrobe and Mountain Hardware is a staple for me!
review.name: Go For It!  I did, and I LOVE em!!!

review.reviewBody: I've had these for over a year and I've used them for bouldering and both indoor and outdoor sport climbing and they are my favorite climbing-specific leggings. I've tried other versions from other brands that have extra reinforcement on the knees and butt, but I tend to find them imbalanced as far as fabric thickness, mobility, and style, and they also tend to snag on granite in the non-reinforced areas. These have the stronger fabric all the way up the front and back of the legs so that never happens. Having thinner fabric along the insides of the legs gives nice breathability and heat venting. I got these in an awesome black spruce color and I really like how durable, yet lightweight and stretchy the fabric is. They are comfortable all day, hold up great on real rock, and are super dependable while being a great thickness without ever feeling to hot, even on the most sweltering days. They are not 5 stars because, as other reviews talk about, the fabric does pill a bit, especially around the seams. I have one of those shaver devices for clothes so I can take care of the pilling, but it is a slight design flaw. I'm 5'8", 135lbs and I got mediums.
review.name: Favorite Climbing-specific Leggings

review.reviewBody: Like others, this product was fantastic two seasons ago. Stretchy, didn’t slip, wonderful. Now the fabric has no stretch and I couldn’t get it over my hips. Horrible change. Should have listened to the reviews.
review.name: Bring back the old material!

review.reviewBody: I have hit the slopes 4 or 5 times and these are super warm and appear they will be durable. Last time I went it was in the teens temperature-wise and I wasn't cold at all.  My last gloves were swany and I think I had them for a decade so I would highly recommend these.
review.name: Awesome gloves

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my son to replace a worn out pair of OR gloves he loved.  These are awesome.  I worried they might be too bulky with the wrist gaiter, but they slide easily over his jacket and the mitten is articulated and form fitting enough that he still has good dexterity and the gloves are really warm.  Would definitely buy again.
review.name: Love Them.  Warm and not too bulky.

description: Buy the USWE Vertical Plus 10L Hydration Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vertical Plus 10L Hydration Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the USWE Vertical Plus 10L Hydration Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've used this running, hiking, kayaking, and on days at rugby tournaments. Incredibly comfortable strap system. Plenty of storage. Extremely easy to clean reservoir. Nothing to dislike here.
review.name: Constant adventure companion.

review.reviewBody: I had to return it because even adjusted out to the max it didn't fit well over my chest protector. Size large and i am 5ft 10in  170lbs
review.name: Nice pack but........

review.reviewBody: I BOUGHT THIS PACK 3 MONTHS AGO..   BEST PACK I HAVE EVER HAD DOESNT EVEN FEEL LIKE I AM WEARING IT EVEN WITH CHEST PROTECTOR ON UNDER IT.  LOVE IT WILL BUY AGAIN WHEN THIS ONE GOES BAD.
review.name: BEST PACK EVER

review.reviewBody: Got this for my wife to use as a hydration and sundries pack while bushwacking for the native Scrubjay in Ocala National Forest here in Florida.  You can dial in the suspension to fit practically anyone and there is still elasticity in the straps, so if you are breathing heavily or contort your body, the suspension gives with you.  I weigh 100lbs more than my wife and I tried it on too, after adjusting the straps; and also found it uber-comfortable.  I'll use it for light mountain biking and easy multi pitch climbing where I want to change into approach shoes at the top.  Whether you are an avid mountain biker or a "weekend warrior" like us, I think you would find the fit of this pack unlike any other, meaning although it absolutely does not move on your back, it is absolutely comfortable across your rib cage and chest.  Oh, and there's a GoPro mount that works with this pack; which is pretty cool if you ask me!  This is most certainly NOT the last USWE product I'll be buying; I'm shortly going to order an Explorer 26!
review.name: Incredible suspension system!

name: Vertical Plus 10L Hydration Pack

review.reviewBody:
Really Poor - bought these ahead of a 5 day hike. Did the job on those days of keeping stones and mud out of boots. Was slightly surprised at the construction given the high cost - lightweight and relatively soft fabric for the price but have always had faith in the Rab name.

At end of the week I noticed the frabric areas around the hard plastic loops on both had worn through showing holes. 

Can only assume this is a manufacturing fault given it’s appeared in both sets.

 Very disappointing given the high cost of these gaiters. Would post pictures but unable to on website.
review.name: Poor

review.reviewBody:
Never used gaiters before. These are light enough for you not to know you are wearing them, entirely unrestrictive as far as movement is concerned and don’t twist, rustle excessively or fall down, something I had worried about - they stay put via good strapping and a lace clip.
I don’t doubt these are waterproof and they formed a good join with my Merrell trail shoes, but the ultimate test - sinking into a bog up to mid-calf and my shoes staying dry - will have to wait, as will breathability (Epping for 4 hrs at around freezing wasn’t an ideal test of that); Certainly it is clear that wading through sodden knee-high grass would be fine (Pennine Way).
I have confidence these will work well; 4 stars only because a full field test has yet to be conducted.
review.name: TAR

review.reviewBody: They're stylish and beautifully made. Do their job perfecty. I love RAB
review.name: They're stylish and beautifully made.

review.reviewBody: Good gaiter but the securing hook has been turned upside down from the old design. It makes securing the hook much more difficult and time consuming. The lack of a zip just exacerbates the hook problems. In short the gaiter design has been significantly changed and not in our opinion for the better. If I have realised the changes at the time of purchase I would not have ordered this item
review.name: Good gaiter but the securing

review.reviewBody:
Bought these to wear on the golf course when muddy. Much better than wearing waterproof trousers over the top.
Excellent snug fit with great size. The elasticated part keeps them snug. Far less mud than wearing trousers.
Wish I’d bought sooner.
review.name: Fantastic Product

review.reviewBody: Lovely gaiters super waterproof they stay on all day and kept my feet dry even after falling in several bogs
review.name: Awesome gaiters

review.reviewBody: Delighted with this product,fit perfect,delivered on time,missing the underboot strap but delivered next day
review.name: Delighted with this product,fit perfect,delivered

review.reviewBody: High quality gaiters. Snug fit around the boot which you need when walking through mud. Happy walker.
review.name: High quality gaiters. Snug fit

review.reviewBody: Upper snaps broke on first try
review.name: Defective

review.reviewBody:
Excellent. Easy to put on and take off with Velcro - no zip which is great. Been through a lot of mud recently with no leakage.

Only reason for one star down is that although both velcro strips on a gaiter are equal length, when on your foot one side seems to be longer than the other which means it’s hard to join the two Velcro strips smoothly. It doesn’t really matter though.
review.name: Excellent. Easy to put on

name: Trek Gaiter

review.reviewBody: The best keeps me super warm . I don’t need anything else love my Cotopaxi. . Super fun colors!!
review.name: Warmmy

review.reviewBody: Great pullover but for the length needed I have to go up to a large and a large is too baggy on me.
review.name: Too wide for length needed

review.reviewBody: This pullover fleece is unbelievably warm and cozy. I have 4 of them, all in beautiful colors. They wash and dry perfectly and come out looking like new.
review.name: Love! Love!

review.reviewBody: A great warm piece, but I'm a standard medium and found the width of the chest. . . . just odd. Tight. So, I returned it. Somewhat unflattering. I also didn't love that the pockets, which I'd prefer to be soft fleece, were lined with nylon or poly. Burr. . .
review.name: Oddly sized

review.reviewBody: I stopped wearing fleece for awhile due to it attracting so much dog hair. But I really liked this pullover and wanted another layering piece and it was on sale and I am so glad I did. It’s very comfortable and warm and the dog hair doesn’t stick to it!
review.name: Cozy fleece that stays clean!

review.reviewBody: Bought for a gift and my mom says it’s soft and really comfortable.
review.name: Super warm and cozy

review.reviewBody: Overall a fair product though not as well fitting and comfortable as expected. Compared to Patagonia or Northface not quite as form fitting and comfortable as the competitors. Also the chest area is not designed for a large bust even at large size. Very tight at the bust and very loose at the waist. Maybe a slight redesign would be helpful with more custom fit.
review.name: Fit & Finish not as expected

review.reviewBody: I love the color, but the fabric is stiff and the sizing is very big and boxy. I would have returned, but bought on a sale. The colors are pretty, but it’s not flattering at all.
review.name: Beautiful color

review.reviewBody: I am super happy about my recent purchase. The feel of the fleece and overall construction are excellent. The fit is great as well. The length is fantastic! It covers the waistline even when doing overhead work.
review.name: Quality construction and great feel.

review.reviewBody: Fits true to size. My only compliant is that it is 2-3” longer in the body than I would like it. I am 5’8” but have an average length torso. This would NOT work well for petites.
review.name: Warm, dense fleece

name: Teca Fleece Pullover - Women's

review.reviewBody: I wear a 9-9.5 shoe and I ordered a 9.5 since the reviews say they run a bit larger. To me they run small. I will be buying the next size up because they were super comfortable in every other aspect.
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody:
I have "E" width greek feet and narrow heels. The fit of this shoe definitely is very close to the instinct vs/vsr line. I would say the toebox width is slightly more narrow and softer than the instincts; softness mainly due to the softer toe patch rubber and shorter midsole in the shoe vs the instincts.

Only weakness for me is the heel hooking most likely due to my narrow heels. Heel fits nicely along the bottom to back of my heel and stays locked in when pulling, however the (L/R) sides bag out a little making the heel slide left and right easily when doing some hard heel hooks. 

Street shoe US 10/10.5 depending on brand, swaying more 10 if anything.
For reference these shoes fits me the best which includes my narrow heel:
Up Moccs 8.5 and 9
Evolv Shamans 10.5
review.name: Almost perfect indoor shoe

review.reviewBody: I've had these shoes for about three weeks and have taken them on several adventures. They perform indoor bouldering very well, sticking to disgusting slab footholds and clinging to overhangs like a bat. they do great in the outdoors as well. Recently climbed some basalt and they do great on the sharp rock, as well as sandstone the rubber grabs and clings. I have a 10.5 street shoe and sized these down for performance to a 10. I would recommend just getting your street shoe size because they are a little to tight for my liking but super comfortable and soft.
review.name: built like a bullit

review.reviewBody: I have wide feet. Like, maybe even abnormally wide feet. These are my cinderella shoe. They hug my foot without crushing it, they secure my heel, and I can actually feel where I'm applying pressure in my big toe. I prefer them over any other shoe I've tried.
review.name: Best Bouldering Shoe

review.reviewBody: I was impressed by how comfy these shoes are are right out of the box. I wore these when they were brand new for an entire gym session and they did not destroy my feet. I am sucker for comfy, but not at the expense of performance. Fortunately, these shoes do not make sacrifices. In the gym, they are good for just about everything. You can get a lot of rubber on the large format holds gyms mostly use, they work especially well on volumes, and they toe hook very well. I have also worn them outside to boulder on granite, sandstone, and sport climb on limestone and they performed well across the board. If you need to put a lot of weight on little edges I would not recommend these shoes, but if you want a good general purpose shoe, I would recommend these.
review.name: Magic Bullit

review.reviewBody: Absolutely loving these shoes, have been using them a bunch in the gym and have been perfect. Everything from edging, heels, toes and volume!
review.name: Main shoe

review.reviewBody: This things have been so great for small footholds. Still enough to be technical but still have enough softness to move with your feet. Also really great for technical heel hooks!
review.name: Great for Small Footholds

review.reviewBody: I really enjoy this shoe! It fits similar to the Scarpa Instinct VS but the toe rubber is softer. I wear a street size US mens 10 and I got these in 10.5 for comfort fit. I'd get a 10, or MAYBE 9.5 for a performance fit.
review.name: Softer alternative to Instinct VS

review.reviewBody: This shoe fits very similar to a Scarpa Instinct, thus It's a great shoe for a wider forefoot. I ordered the same size, and its a bit tighter, but perhaps not a full 1/2 size difference. It is marketed as a super soft bouldering shoe but It feels more powerful than a VSR, more like the VS with its XS-Edge rubber. I went 1 US size down from street shoe for a very tight performance fit, but due to it fitting my foot type well there is no pain. The shoe does break in a bit, but I wouldent say it stretches a 1/2 size like the literature. It has a moderate downturn, again very similar to an Instinct.
review.name: Great Alternative To Scarpa Instinct
comment: I Just got the INstinct VS in Size EU49 & I ordered these shoes back in January but shipping has taken quite some time.  Seems my research matches your description well.  I am thinking of sending back the Instinct VS now & just waiting for these to arrive.   I have two different feet. The Right foot is a normal Roman Cascading foot, with the second toe only a tiny bit shorter than my big toe, but my left foot the second toe is longer than my big toe & I have encountered so many issues with climbing shoes because of this.  The Scarpa Instinct VS is close but not perfect. Would you say this has a wider toe? Because I don't want to have two Boulder shoes for wide feet.  BUt my OCUN won't arrive for another 2 weeks.

name: Bullit Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody:
It took a few ride to dial in the fit of the saddle.  I had to replace my old seat post as it didn't allow for the saddle to be moved back far enough.

But, the saddle itself has been great.  Love the curve of the saddle, and now that it is the correct position it fits quite well.  Did a 50 mile ride yesterday, over 3 hours, 0 issues with the saddle.
review.name: So far, so good...

review.reviewBody: I've put a few thousand miles on this saddle over the past year or so. I was actually able to take it to a bike fitting and talk about usable width vs measured width, and even though I do have pretty narrow measured sit bones (90mm I think but it's SO subjective), I am definitely still more comfortable on the Dynamic than the Evolution (the narrower minimal padding sibling to the Dynamic). The design philosophy with SMP is proven at the World Tour level as well as being a favorite of bike fitters, with shaping that works well with human pelvises. I love the long rails to adjust setback, and have used this thing on gravel and road bikes with absolutely zero complaints.
review.name: Get Your Fit

review.reviewBody:
This saddle is fantastic, among the best I've used and what I put on my bike for long rides. It's on the firmer side as far as padding but has a decent amount of compliance in the shell so I find it comfortable even on gravel. 

On rougher terrain (atv trails and singletrack) or riding without a chamois the Blaster with more padding is a better choice.

The nose looks a little goofy but does its job getting out of the way, and the cutout  carrying through the nose is part of what makes this saddle great. It does fix you in one position so if you're the type of rider who likes to shift your weight forward and back over the course of a ride, look for something different with a flatter profile.

It did take a fair bit of time to dial in the angle - just a few millimeters nose up or down  can drastically affect comfort. The rails are quite long so it's easy to adjust for saddle setback.

The downsides:
1. It's heavy.
2. There's a bridge between the rails at the rear that makes some seat packs not fit well.
3. It looks a little goofy.
4. It's expensive.
review.name: Well Worth Trying

review.reviewBody:
I don't think about this saddle at all while I am riding - which is what one wants!   For me, it offers a great balance of a compliant base, enough padding to noticeably damp road vibrations without adding too much weight, an extremely comfortable Selle SMP shape, and a reasonable weight (290g).  It's also superbly made and durable.

A few years ago I switched to Selle SMP when I went for a fitting and the fitting fixture had a Selle SMP Carbon Lite installed on it.  Its shape looked scary, but it was astonishingly comfortable.  I decided to change to that saddle.  The Carbon Lite's unpadded carbon fiber worked great for me for several years, until I developed a small but persistent cyst Down There.  Grateful to find a dermatologist who got rid of it without resorting to surgery.

Unclear if the hardness of the Carbon Lite caused the cyst, but changing to a more compliant saddle seemed wise.  Discovered that Selle makes a series of saddles in that same shape (plus a different series shaped for people with narrower pelvises): Carbon Lite (bare carbon fiber), Forma (a base made of nylon 12 containing bits of carbon fiber for reinforcement, covered, no padding), Dynamic (same as Forma but with 5mm of firm padding), Drakon (same as Forma with 10mm padding), Lite 209 (same as Forma with 10mm padding in nose, 14-16mm further back).

Aware that people need to try these saddles to understand the shape, Selle SMP produces test saddles of each model in an ugly red/yellow combination (so people won't simply keep the test saddles!).  For a refundable $260 hold on one's credit card, the US importer Albabici will ship out test saddles of any three models for one to ride on for a few weeks and then ship back.  I tested Forma, Dynamic, and Drakon and decided on Dynamics for my road bikes and a Drakon for my trainer.  Have been using them for over a year (6000mi on the Dynamics) and they work great.

The shape of these saddles makes comfort extremely sensitive to fore-aft angle.  I suspect that negative reviews may come from people who didn't get this angle set optimally for them.  Typical range is 2-5 degrees nose down, measured from top of the nose to top of the rear of the saddle.  If the saddle is too nose-down, one tends to slide forward onto the narrow nose and/or get arm pain from combatting that.  Too nose-up can cause pain in tender bits as one tries to lean forward.  So one sets an angle, rides the bike, and adjusts the angle as necessary.  Easiest way to measure this angle is to use a digital level atop a (straight!) piece of wood laid on top of the saddle (the bike must be leveled out axle-to-axle first).

This saddle has round stainless steel rails.  Most Selle SMP models are also available with carbon rails, which save 50-60g at an additional cost of just under $200.  Up to you whether that's worth it.
review.name: It disappears!

name: Dynamic Saddle
